Description: Defines the structural rules governing how MODIFIER templates attach to AXIOM templates. Authoritative source for binding legality in the LOGOS externalization system.

Binding_Rules.Binding_Granularity_Note: Modifiers bind to AXIOM categories, not individual AXIOM primitives. The compiler resolves the specific AXIOM primitive at runtime.
Binding_Rules.Conflict_Resolution_Note: If two modifiers of the same function type are requested for a single AXIOM invocation, externalization halts. No fallback, no priority ordering, no silent discard.
Binding_Rules.Compilation_Order_Note: Modifiers are applied after AXIOM template loading and slot binding, before any CONTEXTUAL templates (Step-3). This ordering is invariant.

Excluded_Targets.Exclusion_Reason: Explanation primitives are terminal and non-composable. ARTIFACT_REFERENCE is a pointer, not a truth claim. Modifying either is semantically incoherent.

REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT_Applicability.Note: REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT targets failure-state primitives within each category. The compiler must restrict application to the following primitives at runtime.

Invariants: Modifiers must not alter the truth value of the target AXIOM
Modifiers must not introduce new semantic primitives
Modifiers must not stand alone; compilation without a parent AXIOM is invalid
Binding is at category level; individual primitive resolution occurs at compile time
Stacking of distinct modifier functions is permitted; stacking of identical functions is fatal
No modifier may trigger sequencing, advance meaning, or produce inward signals
On any binding violation, externalization halts â€” no fallback rendering permitted
This contract does not govern CONTEXTUAL or DISCOURSE bindings
